ygData.msgSnippet: Yeah well that s all well and good jerome, but at the end of the day, when i have one of the key chars in a incident in the game where events are occuring at

Yeah well that's all well and good jerome, but at the
end of the day, when i have one of the key chars in a
incident in the game where events are occuring at the
rate of actions in a melee round and people post two
or three posts in a row that span a couple of minutes,
that's outright modding. Not good! And just so people
know, i treat any post that cuts me off like that as
invalid, for the very reason i stated 2 sentances
back.

 --- Jerame Johnson <jeramej@...> wrote: > HEy
Bro I Post once a day and that is when I go to
> bed But I am so COnfused right now as to what is
> going on in the game. I mean I have one Char that is
> dong nothing but polishing his well umm you get the
> Meaning. I am not tryin to get on people's bad side
> but HEY SLOW DOWN ON THE POST. THANK
>
YOU>!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!<>
> 
> Polar Claw <cycodrone@...> wrote:For future
> reference, can people make sure that they
> don't over post when other players are in a scene. I
> realise that most players here are from the states
> and
> that it's easy to forget that some of us are in
> different timezones, but it seriously isn't fun when
> I
> have to disregard two or three posts made becasuse
> people post over that top of me while i was either
> asleep or at work. So if people could remember that
> in
> future it would be appreciated *Steps off his podium
> on his high horse and stops ranting*
